model.caption: How do Germans remember the World Wars?

synopses.long: Can people in today's Germany mourn their dead without whitewashing their country's past? We ask three Germans, ahead of the 100th anniversary of the end of World War One.

model.caption: Stephen Richardson had to have his leg amputated because of type 2 diabetes

synopses.long: Every week 170 people in the UK lose a limb because of diabetes. Around four million people in the UK are living with diabetes - and around 90% of them have type 2 diabetes, which is often linked to being overweight or inactive. Diabetes prescriptions are costing the NHS in England more than Â£1 billion a year, according to figures from NHS Digital. And a further 12 million people could be at risk of getting type 2 diabetes in the future. Stephen Richardson has told the BBC he blames himself for the loss of his limb.
synopses.medium: Stephen Richardson admits he ignored advice about diet and exercise.
synopses.short: Diabetes type 2: 'I blame myself for the loss of my leg'

model.title: 'I lost my leg to type 2 diabetes' (NON UK)
